skillTree.localised_description: The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.
The god of money, wealth and power protects it's patrons with a shield of coins.
These men are attracted by the prospect of riches and wealth and would fight under any banner. Exactly the type of men to fight for Marienburg, all they need is a firm hand.

effects.description:
Leadership: +8 for Sartosa Free Company
	(Hero's army)

Melee Defence: +8 for Sartosa Free Company
	(Hero's army)
Grants the South Dock's Pirates banner

skillTree.localised_description: The Van Klumpf's buccanneers are known as the Marienburg murderers, for their ruthless tactics and murderous prowess. They are feared amongst enemy and allies a like. Their behaviour unpredicatble, their skill undisputed.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +8 for the Van Klumpf's Buccaneers (Swordsmen)
	(Hero's army)

Weapon Strength: +10% for Van Klumpf's Buccanneers (Swordsmen)
	(Hero's army)

Upkeep: -20% for Van Klumpf's Buccanneers (Swordsmen)
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Golden Pinions flock to wealth like flies flock around a corpse. The promise is wealth is their obession. This makes them a perfectly suitable core for a Van der Kuyper mercenary army. Their golden armor would suggest a capable force in combat, however most of it is stolen and their member comprised of former bandits and militia leaders.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +8 for Golden Pinions (Halberdiers)
	(Hero's army)

Phyiscal Resistance: +10% for the Golden Pinions (Halberdiers)
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are two theories as to why these men are present on the battlefield. One is that van de Kuypers has soo much wealth, it is too much to store. The other and more plausible however, is that Jaan has grown so paranoid he never leaves his wealth out of his sight.

effects.description:
Armour: +8 for Merchant's Guild Baggage-Train
	(Hero's army)

Experience Gain: +50% for Merchant's Guild Baggage-Train
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Suiddock is one of the poorer districts of Marienburg and houses cutthroats, gamblers and dockworkers a like. Pieter was raised among fights and squabble, learning to hold his own with cutlass and dices.

effects.description: Global recruitment duration: -1 turns for Burgher Militia

skillTree.localised_description: Not just capable with the sword, Pieter has a taste for wealth, value and business. His posture commands respect amongst the common folk, and they respect his ability to evenly share the loot after battle. Some say this is a mistake, however..
Strompoort is a mighty tower that looks over the River Reik and the maritime gateway of Marienburg. Stacked with powder and metal chains to stop any hostile fleet in it's track.

On the seaward end of Tempelwijk by the entrance to Manaanshaven, Baron Henryk's College of Navigation and Sea Magicks is one of the Old World's premier centres of learning the crafts of seamanship. Pieter learned however, a hook has more functionalities than learned at Baron Henryk's.

Whenever House Van de Kuypers ship precious cargo, ''Big Piet'' is embedded on board of the various ships to prevent daring thieves, raiders and pirates to interfere with Guild business. Pieter de Groot is known to have never lost any cargo.

skillTree.localised_name: The One they call Big Piet
skillTree.localised_description: Pieter de Groot, commonly named ''Big Piet'', is well over six feet tall and powerfully built. His sandy hair and beard are close-cropped, and his blue eyes look somehow too small for his square face, which is rounded off by a razor-sharp jawline

Big Piet is the man who upheld the honour of the guild (and the whole Suiddock) in a trial-by-combat against the champion of a Tilean merchant house, as he has bested many champions in these trials before.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Experience per turn is increased by an additional 20
Training action: Experience per turn is increased by an additional 35
Training action: Experience per turn is increased by an additional 50

skillTree.localised_description: "I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!"

effects.description: Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 3%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 8%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Trade and investment are the pillars of development.

effects.description: Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +6%
Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +16%
Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +30%

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

items.colour_text: Guildmaster of one of the Merchant Guilds of Marienburg. The Stevedores and Teamsters Guild enjoys a complete monopoly over unskilled labour on Marienburg's docks, and as a result all manual laborers are indirectly on Lea-Jan's pay roll. Tough, arrogant and brutal. A sharp negotiator, he has made the Merchant Houses realize that to get anything done on the docks, they have to go through him. He is loyal to those who are loyal to him and ruthless with those who aren't. He deeply loves Suiddock and its people. He has clandestine contacts with most of the Directorate and used to be Big Piet's employer before Jaan van de Kuyper's took interest in Piet's abilities.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

Construction time: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

items.colour_text: In the Red Cock Inn they sing a song for Big Piet: No one's slick as Pieter, No one's quick as Pieter, No one's neck's as incredibly thick as Pieters, For there's no man in town half as manly - Perfect, a pure paragon. You can ask any Tom, Dick or Stanley and they'll tell you whose team they prefer to be on. No one's been like Pieter, A king pin like Pieter - No one's got a swell cleft in his chin like Pieter. My, what a guy, that Pieter. No one fights like Pieter, no one douses lights like Pieter. No one strikes like Pieter, makes those beauts like Pieter. Then goes tromping around wearing boots like Pieter.

ui_effects.localised_text: Increases this unit's ability to knock enemies back while active

stat_effects.description: x0.015 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold

items.colour_text: Pieter de Groot is all to known with even the most obscure and hidden alleyways of Marienburg. At the end of Gold Harbour canal, close to what's left of the Noordhaven waterfront in the oldest part of Guilderveld, stands a small, unobtrusive doorway with a dirty window beside it and a peeling sign reading 'Ship's Chandlers'. It is one of the fronts used by the various smugglers active in Marienburg, and this particular operation is under Big Piet's protection. In turn, they share their blueprint for double bottom barrells. A nifty method to ship more cargo, tax-free no less. This design would come in handy on Merchant Guild associates traveling with Merchant Lords.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Very few men combine aptitude for business with a talent for swordplay, Pieter is one of them.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
